p: Singh et al. [ 39] reported that FA was the most interesting part of NS because it has the highest antioxidant activity. Mechraoui et al. [ 18] found that, in β−carotene tests, the IC 50 from the acetone extract was 0.2444 mg/mL. The IC 50 value of pure gallic acid found by Lu and Khoo [ 40] (10.50 µg/mL) was different from that which we found in SA1 containing exclusively gallic acid. The IC 50 for rutin is estimated to be 26.2 mg/mL by Yang et al. [ 41]. The only pure flavonoids like apigenin, quercetin, and naringenin gave interesting antioxidant activity [ 42, 43]. This result can be extrapolated to the results found for fractions SA4, SA5, and SA10 since they only contain these flavonoids.
